programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The conspiracy theories surrounding a UFO sighting in Mexico in 1974. It was reported the object was lost over Coyame, but shortly afterwards a civilian plane crashed nearby.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate whether alien life forms are thriving in Earth's seas, following Russian cosmonauts' discovery of living plankton in space.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The heaviest lift in two seasons pushes Jamie and the team to their limits, leaving them struggling to complete the rescue and get traffic on the Coquihalla Highway moving again.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: An early melt unleashes the local bears weeks ahead of schedule in the Great Alaska Range, Jason's hunt for a home is over and Eustace and Preston's race to the finish ends in ruin.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank spend a large sum of money on cars, bikes and vintage advertising material in Michigan, but it remains to be seen if they can make a profit on their purchases.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Dale gets to work on a beaten-up 1940s boxing bell, before a client brings in a vintage slot machine to be converted into a beer dispenser.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick transforms a child's bicycle from the 1970s, and the owner offers to perform stunts on it for the team in return for a discount.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show, hosted by Rob Brydon, in which team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests Adrian Edmondson, Claude Littner, Cariad Lloyd and Jordan Stephens to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Comedy panel game in which host Sue Perkins asks two teams to decide who is the greatest of the many people who share a particular name. In the first edition, captains Richard Osman and Josh Widdicombe are joined by comedians Rob Beckett and Roisin Conaty, actor Stephen Mangan and historian Kate Williams to answer questions, while anecdotes abound and irreverent points are made, as the panellists jump between highbrow and popular culture.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the quiz show, making a meal of some M-themed food topics as Cariad Lloyd, Dermot O'Leary and Phill Jupitus compete alongside resident panellist Alan Davies. As usual, points are awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting, regardless of whether or not they are correct.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Johnny Vegas, Zoe Lyons, Sara Pascoe and Richard Osman are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The First World War led to a number of astounding war factories, which laid the foundations and paved the way for modern factories of today.

programme.title: Holocaust Escape Tunnel
programme.desc: Archaeologists search for a rumoured escape route from a Nazi execution site in Poland that led to a nearby Synagogue, which was later destroyed by the Soviet army.

programme.title: Trading History
programme.desc: Featuring items belonging to the crew of the Titanic and the Great Train Robbery suspects, plus dresses worn by Bjork and a key belonging to Catherine the Great.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The detective duo are called upon after a man kills his wife in a precise imitation of an illusionist's act on a TV show. When the mutilated body of another woman involved with the couple's solicitor is found with a mysterious symbol carved into her skin, Dalziel and Pascoe find themselves being drawn into the world of the paranormal. Richard E Grant guest stars, with Warren Clarke and Colin Buchanan.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Will returns to duty after recovering from injuries sustained in the explosion and immediately becomes a hero when he foils a suicide bid by long-suffering Louisa Durante. His moment of glory is tinged with disappointment on learning Emma is engaged to Matt, and he later discovers Dan is using steroids to boost his boxing prospects. Aware of the pressure on veterans Tony and Reg, Smithy gives them what seems to be a simple dog-napping case, but it's not long before Sun Hill has a murder inquiry on its hands.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: News, Sport, Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news and sports headlines, plus weather forecasts.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Honour
programme.desc: Part two of two. Banaz' body is found in Birmingham following a lead from a phone tap, but the DNA evidence is destroyed when a water pipe bursts. More evidence from the phones lead to Banaz' father and uncle standing trial, where their solicitors mount a convincing defence - until Bekhal courageously steps forward to deliver evidence from behind a screen. Meanwhile, Caroline tries to arrange for the last two perpetrators to be extradited from Iraq to the UK.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: The funeral industry was under fire over charges before the coronavirus crisis. Now, in one of their tragically busiest ever periods, the spotlight is on them again. Sonali Shah investigates if people are paying too much to say goodbye to their loved ones.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The team wants to tackle an eco-friendly build, and Mike makes it happen when he picks up an original Econobox, a 1977 Honda CVCC, in need of a rebuilt engine.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton visits Germany, where he discovers a nuclear core from a secret Nazi weapon-testing factory.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The second of four FANtasy bike winners is revealed as the guys head to Texas. The OCC crew spends some time with Susan Morisset to learn how best to customise her chopper. The winner heads out to OCC and gets a tour of the facility and a shopping spree at the retail store. Once receiving her bike, she and Sr go for a truly memorable ride.

programme.title: Mighty Trains
programme.desc: The Frecciarossa 1000 and Italo Evo, two of the fastest trains in the world. These high-tech Italian locomotives are capable of negotiating treacherous landscapes.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: Exploring the Beluga Bremen, the world's first multi-purpose heavy-lift cargo carrier.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind glass bottles, hacksaws and ice hockey goalkeepers' masks.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How lacrosse sticks, frozen food, torches and paintbrushes are produced, and the way they have evolved with changes in technology.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How forensic scientists continually re-evaluate unsolved crimes with new evidence and advanced methods of detection.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.sub-title: The Man in the Black Hat
programme.desc: The murder of student Julissa Brisman, found shot and bound in a hotel room in Boston. Police used cameras to find her killer and were shocked by what they uncovered.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The shotgun murders of John and Carolyn Tarwacki. When John Tarwacki Sr discovered the bodies of his son and daughter-in-law in February 2010, the only story told at the scene was found in the snow. Boot prints revealed the path the killer had taken, but the search for a motive led police in a startling direction.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The case of a girl who was abducted while camping with her family, examining the phone call on the anniversary of her disappearance that led to the culprit's conviction.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Examining the work of animal police in the city of San Francisco. Scott rescues a dehydrated pit bull puppy that was left muzzled and chained in the back of a hot car.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is reunited with an old friend, Pluto the singing dalmatian. Plus, cocker spaniel Dusty needs radical ear surgery.

programme.title: I Found the Gown
programme.desc: Three brides who all want to get their wedding dresses at bargain prices set out to find an amazing deal and take home their perfect gown.

programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The secret military aircraft constructed by armed forces in America, South Africa, Russia, Australia and Canada that resemble flying saucers, and have caused a stir with the locals.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of guests Tom Allen, Ed Byrne, Rhys James, Milton Jones and Deborah Frances-White. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Mission: Kill Hitler
programme.desc: A plot to kill the fuhrer that remained secret until the late 1990s. Operation Foxley planned to murder Hitler during his daily morning walk at the Berghof, his Bavarian residence. Two soldiers parachuted into the area were supposed to find a perfect location to shoot Hitler and stop the devastating war. Based on the British Secret Services' declassified documents, using archives and fictionalised reconstitutions, this film recounts the full story and the detailed plan that should have led to the murder of Adolf Hitler, and explains why it failed..

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. A car bomb explodes outside a woman's home before her son suffocates in a sealed lab at the university where he was working on an anti-ageing cream. The detectives learn the family had been targeted by animal rights activists and discover £20,000 was paid into the chemist's account by a pharmaceutical company shortly before his death.

programme.title: News, Sport, Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news and sports headlines, plus weather forecasts.

programme.title: News, Sport, Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news and sports headlines, plus weather forecasts.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Close Encounters
programme.desc: At the Westall School in Melbourne, Australia, students claim they saw a saucer-shaped object in an adjacent field while playing outside. Experts contemplate possible aliens involvement.

programme.title: Close Encounters
programme.desc: Teenager 16-year-old Ron Johnson, who claimed to have witnessed a mushroom-shaped object emitting a near-blinding light while feeding the family sheep in a field.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How the Texas Rangers have progressed from a group to protect settlers in the 19th century to a sophisticated law-enforcement agency.
